thread.title: Belated Valentine’s meal served up for homeless in Bradford
thread.title_full: Belated Valentine’s meal served up for homeless in Bradford | Calendar - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Belated Valentine’s meal served up for homeless in Bradford

organizations.name: keighley association women and children’s centre
muslim women’s council the muslim women’s council

text:
More than 100 people who are homeless or struggling to feed themselves have been served a belated Valentine's dinner in Bradford.
Muslim Women’s Council, which hosts a regular Curry Circle service, celebrated Valentine's Day with several service users at MyLahore.
Faith representatives, volunteers and business owners from across Bradford were also in attendance.
Credit: Muslim Women's Council The dinner was a wonderful way for us to celebrate Valentine’s Day with our service users and our catering partners. We would like to thank all our volunteers and supporters, especially MyLahore and SKT Welfare.
– Bana Gora, CEO, Muslim Women’s Council The Muslim Women’s Council runs the Curry Circle, an initiative that provides a hot two-course meal for people who are homeless or struggling to get by.
Since its launch in December 2013 the Curry Circle has provided over 20,000 meals.
Curry Circle runs every Thursday from 6pm to 8pm at the Carlisle Business Centre, Bradford and every Monday from 7pm at Keighley Association Women and Children’s Centre, Keighley. Last updated Fri 17 Feb 2017 Bradford West Yorkshire
